trans-unit.target: TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_00<tab>Guildmaster Luciane wants you to attend to your fellow archers.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_01<tab>Both Silvairre and Leih Aliapoh appear to be lost in thought. Speak first with Silvairre and see what is troubling him.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_02<tab>Silvairre grudgingly reveals his intention to leave the guild. He is determined to bring Pawah Mujuuk to justice, believing that it will grant him a measure of redemption for the time he failed to do so as a Quiverman. Realizing that you cannot sway him from his path, you resolve to turn your attention to Leih, who seems utterly crestfallen.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_03<tab>As if Silvairre's announcement weren't shocking enough, Leih declares her intention to leave not only the guild, but Gridania at large. Before she departs, however, she would speak with you in private. Meet her in the South Shroud and see her off on her journey.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_04<tab>Leih reveals that she believed her place to be with her fellow Keepers of the Moon, and not with the people of Gridania. However, she could not bear to let Pawah murder you, and was thus denied the company of her kind. With nowhere left to go, she asks you to meet her at the Bannock, and help her to understand how one can live as an outsider in Gridania.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_05<tab>Leih flies into a rage and attacks you, leaving you little choice but to fight, as a crowd of slack-jawed Twin Adder recruits look on. After you subdue her, she awakens as if from a trance, realizing that the fear of dishonoring her old family, who perished in the Calamity, was preventing her from embracing her new one. She resolves to return to the guild and be with those who know her best. Follow in her wake and inform Luciane that all is well.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SEQ_06<tab>Before you can utter a word, Luciane bids you stop, and states that merely looking at the returning Leih's eyes has told her all that she needs to know. She thanks you for helping Leih to see that her place is with the guild, and hopes that you will be of similar aid to other archers who lose their way.
※The next archer quest will be available from Luciane upon reaching level 30.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Silvairre.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Leih Aliapoh.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_TODO_02<tab>Meet Leih Aliapoh in the South Shroud.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Leih Aliapoh at the Bannock.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_TODO_04<tab>Report to Luciane.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_1<tab>Ah, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, I had hoped you would come. You may be able to help. I am concerned about Leih and Silvairre...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_2<tab>They show signs of losing perspective, and... Well, mayhap it is best you see for yourself. I cannot help but feel that both would benefit from your counsel.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_3<tab>Consider this a personal request, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_10<tab>Hm? Oh, <var 1A 02 /var>gods<var 1A 01 /var>... Did Luciane send you to pester me, by any chance? This is hardly her concern, and it is most <var 1A 02 /var>definitely<var 1A 01 /var> not yours.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_11<tab>If you must know, I have decided to leave the guild.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_12<tab>I mean to track down Pawah Mujuuk and finish what we started. The Gods' Quiver and Wood Wailers seem content to ignore our warnings, but I will not let her escape again.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_13<tab>I already made that mistake once, and it cost me my place in the Gods' Quiver.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_14<tab>Aye, the foolish young sentry of whom I once spoke─he was me. <sigh> We had her, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. There was no escape. But then she began to wail about a wounded comrade, one who would surely die without her help... She looked me straight in the eye and <var 1A 02 /var>begged<var 1A 01 /var>...

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_15<tab>And I blinked. I failed to see through the most elementary ruse. I failed Gridania and the Gods' Quiver...and while that can never be forgiven, mayhap I can reclaim a measure of honor by stopping her.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_16<tab>...But a wanderer like you would not understand what it means to betray your people.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_17<tab>Worry not─I do not intend to leave just yet. I will continue to gather information until I am certain of Mujuuk's whereabouts. Make no mistake, though─it is only a matter of time.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_18<tab>Now run along, will you? Oh, and if you are so concerned about your fellow guildmates, you should attend to that moping Miqo'te. The sight of her shuffling around whilst staring at her feet is bad for morale.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_SILVAIRRE_000_19<tab>...Not that it matters to me.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_20<tab>Oh...it's you. Tell me, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, do you ever think about home? Do you ever wish you could go back?

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_21<tab>Mine was just another poor village in the Twelveswood. The fields were more stone than soil, and merchants hardly ever bothered to visit. We didn't have a lot...but we didn't need it.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_22<tab>And then the Calamity came. I remember running, and the screams... It was so <var 1A 02 /var>loud<var 1A 01 /var>, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>...so unbearably loud... And then I was here, in a strange city, surrounded by more people than I'd ever seen, and I didn't know any of them.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_23<tab>But I knew how to hunt. I was always good at hunting, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, and the guild gave me a place to get better.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_24<tab>At least I thought I had gotten better. She...Pawah Mujuuk...she was so much more...

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_25<tab>I've been thinking, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, that maybe this is a sign. Maybe Silvairre is right, and this guild─this city─is no place for an outsider like me.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_26<tab>And so I've decided to leave. I'm glad to have known you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, even if it was only for a short while.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_27<tab>Forgive me if this is too selfish a request, but before I go, I would like to meet with you one last time.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_28<tab>Alone, in the South Shroud. These...Gridanians would not understand.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_30<tab>No! Don't hurt <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var>!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_31<tab>And there I was, thinkin' ye mightn't accept my kind invitation!

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_32<tab>...I don't recall invitin' <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var>, though... 'Tis <var 1A 02 /var>rude<var 1A 01 /var> to presume, <var 08 E905 ((missy)) ((sonny)) /var>, an' I do so hate rudeness...

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_33<tab>Wait! It's not <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> fault─it's mine! I invited <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var>. <var 08 E905 ((She)) ((He)) /var>'s a member of the Archers' Guild, like me─and <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var>'s not Gridanian!

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_34<tab>Ahhh...I do begin to recall <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((his)) /var> face... Aye, knows how to hold a bow, that one. Well, <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> ain't the typical recruit, but I reckon I might be willin' to make an exception.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_35<tab>No, no─it's not like that. I just...I wanted to say good-bye.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_36<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, ever since I met Pawah, I've been at a loss. But I realize now that my place isn't at the guild...with the Gridanians.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_37<tab>They'll never accept me. This is where I belong, with <var 1A 02 /var>my<var 1A 01 /var> people, carrying on our traditions. Our archery─not Gridania's.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_38<tab>It's all I have left, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. So I'm going with Pawah. Maybe you don't understand now, but...just promise me you won't tell Luciane...or Silvairre.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_Q1_000_1<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_A1_000_1<tab>As you wish.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_A1_000_2<tab>The hells I won't!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_40<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_41<tab>Made yer peace with yer little friend, have ye? Right then, let's get on with it!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_45<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_46<tab>Heh! I had a feelin' <var 08 E905 ((she)) ((he)) /var> might be harborin' a few nigglin' objections. Worry not, sister...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_50<tab><var 08 E905 ((Put an arrow in her)) ((Shoot the bastard)) /var>!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_51<tab>NO!

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_52<tab>Ain't no love lost 'twixt ye an' the guild, is there? Then what's the problem with featherin' a bloody 'venturer? No bugger'll miss <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var>.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_53<tab><var 1A 02 /var>I'll<var 1A 01 /var> miss <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var>, all right!? So just...just stop!

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_54<tab>Dear me... An' I had such high hopes for you, Miss Aliapoh... Waste o' bloody time! A Keeper what's lost her nerve's about as much use to me as a glass bow.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_55<tab>But there's no sport in killin' captured prey.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_PAWAHMUJUUK_000_56<tab>Ack! I'd better not see neither o' ye again, 'cause if I do, I'll show ye what happens to prey what's daft enough to get caught twice. Away, sisters! Away!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_60<tab>How do you do it, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>? How do you live in this place─with these people?

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_61<tab>And why do you even bother? What have they ever given you beside scorn? Well? What do you <var 1A 02 /var>see<var 1A 01 /var> in them, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_62<tab>Even though you joined the guild after I did, you've come so far, so quickly. Maybe you've even surpassed me...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_63<tab>I have to know how you've done it. I have to know what it is that I'm doing wrong...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_64<tab>...And there's only one way I can think of to find out. Meet me at the Bannock.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_70<tab>Shall we begin, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_71<tab>Whenever you're ready. I'll be waiting.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_72<tab>Then defend yourself! Show me what these people have taught you!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_80<tab><pant> <pant> It's so simple...

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_81<tab>You have opened your eyes, and looked beyond your masters' faults. You've accepted their teachings and taken them to heart. Even Silvairre, for all his bigotry, wishes only to preserve his traditions.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_82<tab>I lost sight of everyone else's struggles and became obsessed with mine own. I was so afraid to let go of my cherished notion of archery─my <var 1A 02 /var>family's<var 1A 01 /var> notion─and learn another way. I didn't want to betray them...or dishonor their memory.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_83<tab>...But I have a family here too─a family that sees the wider world, and is willing to show me how blinkered I have become.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_84<tab>As archers, we train our eyes and minds to be unforgiving─to defy any attempt at concealment, and discern the naked truth. It is little wonder then that I have neglected to look inside myself until now. Though unquestionably worthwhile, I have found the experience rather...<var 1A 02 /var>excruciating<var 1A 01 /var>. Ahem!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_85<tab>Thank you, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. I know now that I belong at the guild, together with you and Luciane...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_000_86<tab>...And, yes, even that bloody Wildwood. Gods help me─I think I might actually miss him...
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_90<tab>Welcome home, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_91<tab>You need not say a word. One look at Leih's eyes was enough.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_92<tab>Thank you for returning her to us.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_93<tab>When we focus on a single goal and pursue it with passion and fervor, it becomes easy to lose sight of what else lies before us.

TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LUCIANE_000_94<tab>With your skill and vision, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, you can help your fellow archers to look beyond themselves and remember their comrades. I hope I can count on your support in the future.
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_QIB_TODO_001<tab>Defeat Leih Aliapoh!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_INSTANCE_BATTLE_YESNO_TITLE<tab>Duty calls. Do you wish to proceed with “Homecoming”?
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_INSTANCE_BATTLE_YESNO_YES<tab>Yes
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_INSTANCE_BATTLE_YESNO_NO<tab>No
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_BATTLETALK_01<tab>I said fight me, damn it! Why are you holding back!?
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_BATTLETALK_02<tab>Is that all you've got!? I know you can do better!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_BATTLETALK_03<tab>Not bad...but I'm not finished yet!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_BATTLETALK_04<tab>For my people...for my family...for me!
TEXT_CLSARC005_00071_LEIHALIAPOH_BATTLETALK_05<tab>I...I see now...
